snippet: The foundation that owned artwork stolen from a Rotterdam museum has collected nearly $24 million in insurance, a move that suggests it has given up on recovering the works.
abstract: Triton Foundation, Dutch foundation that owned artwork stolen from Kunsthal Museum by Romanian gang, has collected nearly $24 million in insurance and surrendered ownership rights, move that suggests it has given up on recovering the works.

byline.contributor: Doreen Carvajal contributed reporting from Paris, and George Cailin from Bucharest.

lead_paragraph: The foundation that owned artwork stolen from a Rotterdam museum has collected nearly $24 million in insurance, a move that suggests it has given up on recovering the works.

headline.main: Foundation Gets $24 Million in Insurance on Paintings Stolen From Dutch Museum
headline.print_headline: $24 Million Insurance Paid on Stolen Art
